metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart, enters the inner area of the goblin camp - what was clearly once the central hall of a Temple dedicated to Selûne, the rival of Shadowheart's goddess, Shar. She notes that this must have once been a key area for Selûnite power and wonders what happened here. If she discovered earlier clues, she may believe Sharran allies destroyed this place long ago. The player may or may not be aware of Shadowheart's shar worshop at this point, and can attempt to pry the info from her.

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: Selûne. As if mingling with a horde of goblins wasn't bad enough.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Let's do what we have to, then get out of here.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Not your usual haunt, I take it.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: Quite the understatement, but yes. Let's not linger in this place any more than necessary.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: Selûne is a bad omen - just look what's befallen her temple.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: No matter. I'll breathe easier once we're clear of this place.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You seem to admire whoever left this place a ruin. Got something to say?

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Only that you're overthinking a simple deduction I made.
50.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like this line of questioning, but trying to show it.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You can trust me. I want to know what's concerning you.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: You're not going to let this go, are you? You might wish you had...
40.context: NodeContext: Coming around to telling the truth about herself.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: I worship Shar, the Mistress of the Night. It is my holy mission to oppose Selûne, her teachings and her followers.
25.context: NodeContext: Not information she ever shares lightly.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: Don't make a fuss, Selûnite - we may be at odds, but I have more important concerns than you right now.

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Fantastic. Monsters in our minds, and around our campfire.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Heavens forbid. We're all entitled to our secrets.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I'll decide whether to make a fuss or not. Hard to trust someone who's holding out on me.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: Secrecy is everything for Shar's children. It's our code, our creed, our shield.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: I even keep secrets from myself - I had my memories suppressed, so that nothing I knew could be used against the Dark Lady. Once I prove myself, my memories will be restored.
72.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: I'm not sorry I kept this from you. Not one bit.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: Though perhaps that might change, if you can show an open mind.
62.context: NodeContext: Conceding jus a little towards the player's hurt feelings - but conditionally

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Let's see how open-minded I can be then: tell me more.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: Talk to me later. We've got more pressing matters to see to right now.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: It's been some time since I met another faithful of Shar. Are you versed in her teachings?

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Of course I am. But we can talk about this later - let's go.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: We can discuss this later. But let's just try a little more honesty going forward.

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: All we can do is try, I suppose...

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I don't know how I feel about this.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: Who says you have to feel anything?

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: Gather your thoughts. Then perhaps we can talk some more.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Thank you for telling me, at least.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: Don't thank me - I'm breaking Lady Shar's teachings just by doing so... but sometimes you have to be practical.
2.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I can't trust you. Best if we travel separately for now.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: If you insist. Don't expect to fare well without me to save you.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Don't make a big fuss...? You've been lying to me!

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: A lie of omission at most. I'm sure you have some skeletons of your own hidden away.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You could have told me. How long were you going to keep this secret?

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: Forever, ideally. And you assume too much about what I can and cannot tell.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I didn't agree to join up with a Shar worshipper.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: Then it's your own fault for not asking.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Now that the truth's out, tell me more.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: In future, I expect you to be honest. Let's leave it at that for now.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I don't care who you worship. We have bigger problems.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: True. I didn't think you'd react so pragmatically. Perhaps I should have told you sooner.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Shar is an abomination. You deceived me.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Your blindness as much as my deception, Selûnite. We can talk about this later - if you're willing.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I bow to Shar also. The Dark Lady must favour us, to have brought us together.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: I... yes, she must. I'll offer thanks to her in my prayers - and we should speak more later. Alone, ideally.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: A Shar worshipper? Not my usual quarry - nor my usual ally.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: You worship Shar? Blimey. She and my beloved Mystra are not exactly friends.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Now that you have the truth, please don't make a big fuss about it.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Is your hearing failing you? Or your wits perhaps? There's nothing more to say. Let's move.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You're hiding something. Explain what's going on - now.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: Spare me your dramatics. I already told you all there is to tell. Let's go.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You're far too eager to disrespect Selûne - what's going on?

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like this line of questioning, but trying to show it.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Selûne, a bad omen? Hardly. What's really the matter?

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: We don't have time for this. Besides, I already explained myself.
33.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like this line of questioning, but trying to show it.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Though I'll grant it must have been impressive once, in all its profane glory... until someone razed it.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glancing around the surroundings,NodeContext: Slight concession, glancing around an impressive temple

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Though I'll grant it must have been impressive once, in all its profane glory... I wonder what happened.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glancing around the surroundings,NodeContext: Slight concession, glancing around an impressive temple

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Show some respect. This is a sacred place for me... even in its current state.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: Respect's given freely. If your goddess needs to demand it, she's not worthy of it.
49.context: NodeContext: 'Don't tell me what to do'

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Watch your tongue, Sharran. This is a sacred place for me... even in its current state.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: A ruin abandoned to a murderous horde is a very fitting dedication to Selûne.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You don't have to tell me twice.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: Good. Selûne is a bad omen - just look what's befallen her temple.
